Course Description: NATURE OF ACCOUNTING, FINANCIAL STATEMENTS, THE ACCOUNTING CYCLE, ASSETS, CURRENT LIABILITIES, LONG-TERM DEBT, AND OWNER'S EQUITY; ACCOUNTING FOR PROPRIETORSHIPS AND CORPORATIONS.
Objectives / Learning Outcome(s) / Major:
STUDENTS WILL DEVELOP THROUGHOUT THIS COURSE:/N1. AN UNDERSTANDING OF THE PROCESS OF MEASURING AND DOCUMENTING INDIVIDUAL BUSINESS TRANSACTIONS TO ALLOW FOR THE AGGREGATION OF INFORMATION./N2. AN APPRECIATION FOR HOW ACCOUNTING PRINCIPLES AND DIFFERENT ACCOUNTING TREATMENTS GUIDE THE RECORDING OF TRANSACTIONS TO ULTIMATELY PROVIDE CONSISTENCY AND DIFFERENCES IN THE FINANCIAL REPORTING./N/N3. THE ABILITY TO COMPLETE THE ACCOUNTING CYCLE TO CONSTRUCT FINANCIAL STATEMENTS THAT ARE USEFUL FOR DECISION-MAKING./N/N4. IDENTIFY COMMON FRAUD FOUND IN FINANCIAL REPORTING, AND INTERNAL CONTROLS THAT CAN REDUCE THE LIKELIHOOD OF FRAUD./N/N5. ANALYZE HOW TRANSACTIONS COMMON TO LARGE CORPORATIONS IMPACT EACH OF THE FINANCIAL STATEMENTS, WITH SPECIFIC EMPHASIS ON THE INCOME STATEMENT./N/N6. DEVELOP AN UNDERSTANDING OF THE INTERRELATIONSHIPS WITHIN THE FINANCIAL STATEMENTS.

BLOCK 1/N ACCOUNTING CYCLE - THE PROCESS OF MEASURING/DOCUMENTING BUSINESS TRANSACTIONS THAT ALLOWS FOR AGGREGATION OF INFORMATION TO PREPARE FINANCIAL REPORTING TO PROVIDE COMMUNICATE WITH DECISION MAKERS (CHAPTERS 1 - 3)./N/NBLOCK 2/N/NINTERNAL CONTROLS - USED TO PROTECT COMPANY RESOURCES AND PRODUCE ACCURATE AND RELIABLE FINANCIAL REPORTING (CHAPTER 4)./NPART 1 - ACCOUNTING PRINCIPLES AND TREATMENTS - USED TO GUIDE THE MEASUREMENT OF BUSINESS TRANSACTIONS, WITH A MORE SIGNIFICANT FOCUS ON THE INCOME STATEMENT (CHAPTER 5 - 7)./N/NBLOCK 3/NPART 2 - ACCOUNTING PRINCIPLES AND TREATMENTS - USED TO GUIDE THE MEASUREMENT OF BUSINESS TRANSACTIONS, WITH A MORE SIGNIFICANT FOCUS ON THE INCOME STATEMENT (CHAPTER 8 - 10)./NSTATEMENT OF CASH FLOW - CHANGE IN ANNUAL CASH POSITION (CHAPTER 11).
